meanings.definition: Reduce the official value of a currency in relation to other currencies.
meanings.sent1: The government devalued the currency to help exports.
meanings.sent2: The decision to devalue the currency led to economic changes.
meanings.sent3: When the currency was devalued, it felt like a game of financial chess.
meanings.sent4: The devalued currency was like a deflated balloon in the global market.
meanings.sent5: The act of devaluing the currency painted a vivid picture of economic strategy.

meanings.definition: Cause (something) to lose its value or worth.
meanings.sent1: The flood devalued the antique furniture in the basement.
meanings.sent2: Continuous neglect can devalue even the most precious possessions.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's fake 'masterpiece' devalued the art show.
meanings.sent4: Her careless actions devalued the trust others had in her.
meanings.sent5: The passing of time devalued the once priceless artifact to mere trinket status.
